intro: Monotagma exile, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
